creator: remko@initworks.com
text:
gcc 4.3.4
CFLAGS: -g -m64 -march=k8 (-O2 same result)

there are more core dumps later on in the test but testxml is the first. I added debug symbols to get a stack trace.

testmemcache        : SUCCESS
testxml             : |/bin/bash: line 2: 29634 Segmentation Fault      (core dumped) LD_LIBRARY_PATH="`echo "../dbm/.libs:../dbd/.libs:../ldap/.libs:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH" | sed -e 's/::*$//'`" ./$prog

testxml             : |mdb: stop on SIGSEGV
mdb: failed to read instruction at 0xfffffffffffc4868: no mapping for address
mdb: target stopped at 0xfffffffffffc4868:
> $C
fffffd7fffdffa70 0xfffffffffffc4868()
fffffd7fffdffad0 libexpat.so.1.5.2`XML_Parse+0x281()
fffffd7fffdffb10 libaprutil-1.so.0.3.9`do_parse+0x4b()
fffffd7fffdffb40 libaprutil-1.so.0.3.9`apr_xml_parser_feed+0x2a()
fffffd7fffdffba0 libaprutil-1.so.0.3.9`apr_xml_parse_file+0x8a()
fffffd7fffdffbe0 test_xml_parser+0x6b()
fffffd7fffdffc20 abts_run_test+0x7c()
fffffd7fffdffc40 testxml+0x35()
fffffd7fffdffc80 main+0x1ea()
fffffd7fffdffc90 _start+0x6c()

creator: marcoep@gmail.com
text:
Hi there,

So, what was it exactly? I do *have* 32/64 mixup, which I'm actually trying to track down. I'd appreciate any hint.

Further details (apr-util-1.3.10).

  testxml             : |bash: line 2: 27267 Segmentation Fault        
  LD_LIBRARY_PATH="`echo "../dbm/.libs:../dbd/.libs:../ldap/.libs:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH" | sed -e 's/::*$//'`" ./$prog
  *** Error code 139

on 

  $ uname -a
  SunOS zaqar8 5.10 Generic_138888-05 sun4u sparc SUNW,Sun-Fire-V490

  $ isainfo -v
  64-bit sparcv9 applications
        vis2 vis
  32-bit sparc applications
        vis2 vis v8plus div32 mul32

Thanks,

  ^m'e

Marc,

I made a mistake by using the generated 32bit header file to compile a 64bit bit release. So there is no issue....

Apologies for not closing the ticket
creator: remko@initworks.com
